raw_text:
Mourinho expects fight to finish
 
 Chelsea manager Jose Mourinho expects the Champions League clash with Barcelona to be a fight to the finish.
 
 Mourinho is relishing the first leg of the tie against his former club in the last 16 in the Nou Camp. He said: "I wouldn't be surprised if nothing had been decided by the last minute of the return leg and the match had to go into extra time. "I have to defend what is mine and the Champions League is mine at the moment. I'm the last manager to have won it." Mourinho never coached Barcelona, assisting both Sir Bobby Robson and Louis van Gaal. But he is not envious, insisting: "I don't have to be jealous about Barcelona because they have 100 years of history and have won the European Cup once.
 
 "I have been managing for five years and I have the same amount of Champions League trophies to my name." Barcelona star Ronaldinho admitted: "I think that it is going to be a difficult match for us because Chelsea have a good team full of big stars. "I have seen Chelsea a few times on television, tactically they are very good and they are very strong on the counter-attack. "They pressure very well and keep possession of the ball so it will be important that we play our own game. "I believe they are the two strongest teams in Europe. Nevertheless, Barcelona are accustomed to playing big games at the Nou Camp, where they have to face the likes of Real Madrid each season. "It is a special game, the atmosphere in the city changes, there are lots of journalists but inside the dressing room there is not a lot of difference," Ronaldinho added. "We are only thinking of winning the match with all respect to the opposition."
llama3.2:1b: Jose Mourinho expects a tough match against Barcelona in their Champions League first leg at Chelsea's Stamford Bridge.
He believes that neither team will give up and that the match will go into extra time if necessary.
Ronaldinho for Barcelona agrees, stating that he thinks it will be a difficult match due to Chelsea's strong team and good counter-attack tactics.
llama3.2:3b: Jose Mourinho expects the Champions League tie with Barcelona to be a close and potentially goalless first leg, possibly decided by the last minute, before facing Barcelona in the return leg.
gemma2:2b: Jose Mourinho expects the first leg against Barcelona to be a close match and a fight until the end.
Mourinho believes in his team's chances and emphasizes Chelsea's strong performance as they face off against their former club at the Nou Camp.
Ronaldinho acknowledges the challenging nature of the game but anticipates a difficult match for both teams.
He also states that Barcelona is accustomed to playing big games, especially on their home turf.

Mourinho views this as a fight for first place and adds that he won't be surprised if the tie goes into extra time.
Ronaldinho, Chelsea's star player, agrees with Mourinho but suggests the Barcelona team is better prepared due to their long history and success at this tournament.
Barcelona are accustomed to playing big games at the Nou Camp, which makes them particularly tough opponents for the Blues in this fixture.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Chelsea manager Jose Mourinho expects Champions League clash against Barcelona to be a closely contested final match.
qwen2.5:3b: Mourinho expects a tight Champions League clash against Barcelona.
He views it as a fight to the finish, potentially ending in extra time.
Mourinho acknowledges his former club's rich history but remains confident about Chelsea’s strength and tactical prowess.
Star player Ronaldinho emphasizes the importance of playing their own game despite Chelsea's star power and strong counter-attack.

Despite having 100 years of history and winning the European Cup once, Barcelona still possess the same amount of trophies to their name.
